intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: This way, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What is this place?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: This is Fort Jinya. Sakura is already here, tending to the wounded soldiers and citizens. Let's go and help her.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: By all means.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Corrin! Thank you for coming!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Is everything OK, Sakura? I'm here to help.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Yes, but thank goodness you're here. We're really short staffed.

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: Hello Lord/Lady Corrin. I'm Hana. Lady Sakura has told me all about you.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: And I'm Subaki. It's a pleasure to meet you Lord/Lady Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Nice to meet both of you. I'm afraid you probably know a lot more about me than I know about either of you.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: That's OK, Corrin. I'm sure you'll be fast friends in no time. Hana and Subaki are my retainers—always close at hand and ready to help.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ah, I see. Well, we should have plenty of time to relax and get to know—

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Corrin! We have trouble! Nohrian forces are approaching!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Seriously? We haven't even been here five minutes.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes, well...the Nohrian soldiers haven't wasted any time surrounding us.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Unbelievable.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I can't believe they'd attack at a time like this... We're using most of the fort as a makeshift hospital—there's no military target here! Why can't they just leave us alone?

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: Don't worry, milady. I can handle this.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: With my help, of course. If you'd like, Lady Sakura, you may remain with the wounded while we resolve this.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: I'll consider it. Thank you. Both of you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Well then. I guess we'll be getting to know each other in a hurry. Nothing like a life-or-death situation to cut right through the small talk.

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: As you command, Lord/Lady Corrin! As Lady Sakura's lead retainer, it will be my pleasure to take your orders.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: And as Lady Sakura's supervising retainer, I, too, welcome your leadership.

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: Supervising retainer? That's not a thing.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: Well, neither is a lead retainer. I don't remember you getting a promotion.

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: Lady Sakura and I have been best friends since childhood! I've ALWAYS been her lead retainer.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: I'm not sure this is the time or place for such a discussion, but... I believe my results on the battlefield speak for themselves.

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: Oh, so is that why you neglect all your nonbattle duties? Is that why I'm the one maintaining all of your gear and scouting the enemy?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Guys, um...

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Knock it off, you two! You're embarrassing yourselves—and me! Corrin, please don't let this juvenile display deceive you. Hana and Subaki are both extremely capable on the battlefield. And they're both going to set aside this petty argument and help you, right?

intro.speaker: Hana
intro.line: Of course, milady.

intro.speaker: Subaki
intro.line: Certainly. Expect perfection, and you will not be disappointed.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Excellent. I'm glad to have your support.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: We should get moving and face the intruders head-on. We must protect our wounded!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Of course.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Ho, Corrin! Is that really you?

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: Yes, that's the voice I remember! It IS really you!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Please, drop the act. We don't know each other.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: You honestly don't remember? It's me, Silas! We were best friends as children.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: I don't remember much, I'm afraid.

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Corrin, please be careful. This could be a trap of some sort.

battle.speaker: Silas
battle.line: I promise that I'm telling the truth. However, it seems we are destined to clash swords regardless of our past...

recruit-battle.speaker: Silas
recruit-battle.line: Don't take this personally. I'm just following orders from King Garon...

recruit-battle.speaker: Silas
recruit-battle.line: It didn't have to be this way...

recruit-battle.speaker: Silas
recruit-battle.line: It's been too long, Corrin. I never imagined we'd reunite under these circumstances. I became a knight in hopes of seeing you again, but...

recruit-battle.speaker: Corrin
recruit-battle.line: Silas...I simply don't remember my past.

recruit-battle.speaker: Silas
recruit-battle.line: That's OK. You can still come back to Nohr with me. It's not too late!

recruit-battle.speaker: Corrin
recruit-battle.line: I'm afraid you're wrong. I'm way beyond the point of no return.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Go on. Kill me.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: No. This isn't right.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: What are you waiting for?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You seemed hesitant to attack us, even as you led your army into battle. Why were you holding back? Because we were friends?

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Ugh...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Aren't you here on King Garon's orders? Did you even intend to defeat us?

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Corrin... some things are more important than following orders.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You're going to need to be clearer than that, or I will finish you off!

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Do as you must. I value an oath I made long ago far more than my own life. I still can't believe you don't remember. We used to play together. You always said how badly you wanted to see the world... So one day I made us a picnic and snuck you out for a few hours to explore. I even packed your favorite meal: Surf and turf! I knew taking you beyond the walls was forbidden, but... I also knew how much it would mean to you. The guards tried to execute me when we returned but you wouldn't let them do it.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gods! That does ring a bell...

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: My life belongs to you, friend. Do as you must.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Silas... Silas... Yes, of course! I do remember a childhood friend by that name. One who helped me explore outside the walls that bound me.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Yes! That's it! What else?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Only bits and pieces at the moment... But I have a proposal for you. You say you would sacrifice your own life for mine?

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Indeed.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well. Then join forces with me. I know you are a knight of Nohr... and you may not believe what I'm about to say... But King Garon has gone absolutely mad! He gave me a cursed sword and sent me off to be captured by the Hoshidans. Knowing, of course, that I would be brought before my mother. She was killed when the sword exploded. I would have been too...

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: I...I don't believe it...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's all part of his grand plan to escalate this conflict into a full-blown war. I can't forgive his actions against Hoshido. And I will never return to Nohr.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You must think I'm manipulating you.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: No, Corrin... I believe you. You've spared my life twice now. I have no reason to doubt your story.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Then you will join us?

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Yes. Perhaps together we can bring peace to this world someday.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: That is my aim, Silas. I promise that I will never deviate from the cause.

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: I can't believe this is happening!

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Lady Sakura, we've got bad news.

end.speaker: Orochi
end.line: This is an emergency!

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Saizo, Orochi... What happened to you? You're both wounded!

end.speaker: Orochi
end.line: Our wounds are nothing. but as for Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi—

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: What?! What happened to them?

end.speaker: Orochi
end.line: They're missing. Last anyone saw them, they were headed to Izumo. It's possible they were captured en route. I hate to think of the alternative...

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: No! No, no, no, no...

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Lady Sakura, please take a deep breath. Saizo, Orochi... Please tell me you're joking.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Yes, I'm well known for my japes, aren't I? I blame myself. I should have been at lord Ryoma's side every step of the way.

end.speaker: Orochi
end.line: Pardon me, but you must be Lord/Lady Corrin, yes? I'm Orochi. I used to serve as a diviner for Lady Mikoto. It seems it would serve a common purpose for our army to join forces. Our tactician, Yukimura, is readying the troops to march on Izumo. Time is of the essence! Will you join us in search of Lord Ryoma and Lord Takumi?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, of course. We'll support you in any way that we can.

end.speaker: Orochi
end.line: Thank you. Corrin.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: I'm coming with you.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Lady Sakura, I strongly recommend that you reconsider. The battlefield near the border is highly dangerous, and—

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: I don't care! I can't just stay here and do nothing. If there's anything I can do to help my brothers, I need to be in position to do it.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I'm so sorry, Sakura. But I'm afraid I agree with Kaze...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Corrin... Sakura just lost her mother, and now her brothers are missing. It's understandable she would want to accompany us. With my help I believe we can provide adequate protection...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Very well. I won't try to stop you, Sakura. I just hope you understand the risks.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Thank you, Corrin. I do.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Will you be joining us as well, Silas?

end.speaker: Silas
end.line: Yes, I will join you. Although, I must say that I didn't expect to be pressed into service THIS quickly...

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: You can't be serious, Corrin. You'd really allow this backstabbing Nohrian scum to accompany us.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: This is not your call, Saizo. And besides, if we abandon him here, he dies. That is not the Hoshidan way.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Is the Hoshidan way to allow a potential spy access to our party? I will follow Corrin's lead...for now. But I will keep my eyes wide open.

end.speaker: Orochi
end.line: Saizo!

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Brother, Corrin spared my life when I was a prisoner in Nohr. I assure you that we can trust his/her judgement.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Oh, please. A five-year-old wouldn't be fooled by such an obvious setup.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: I appreciate your skepticism, Saizo. I hope you'll give me a chance to prove you wrong.

end.speaker: Saizo
end.line: Words mean little. Actions are what count. We'll see what happens.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Corrin, we really must press on. Every second counts!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Right, let's get moving.
